div.p: This is the FHIR Implementation Guide for WHO Digital Documentation of COVID-19 Certificates: Vaccination Status (DDCC:VS).

ul.li: The published version of this IG can be found at: https://WorldHealthOrganization.github.io/ddcc

li.strong: This implementation guide and set of artifacts are still undergoing development.

ul.li: The DDCC:VS includes technical specifications and implementation guidance to facilitate implementation of effective and interoperable digital solutions for vaccination certificates for the purposes of continuity of care and proof of vaccination. The DDCC:VS document contains an overview of high level use cases for digital COVID-19 vaccination certificates including workflows; core data elements mapped to standard code systems; functional and non-functional requirements; an overview of digitally signing a certificate with public key infrastructure (PKI) technology; implementation guidance regarding ethical considerations, privacy and data protection principles, and national governance considerations; and this linked FHIR Implementation Guide for the DDCC:VS scope.
This content is for demonstration purposes only.

div.p: This Implementation Guide contains the full set of specifications for the DDCC:VS.
This Implementation Guide is underpinned by supporting guidelines, policies and recommendations

This Implementation Guide is broken into the following levels of knowledge representation:
Narrative Contains references to the guidance, guidelines, policies and recommemndations underpinning this Implementation Guide
Business Requirements Contains the requirements for this Implementation Guide including the defintition of key concepts, use cases and workflows.
Data Models and Exchange Contains the data models and data exchange protocols defined in this Implementation Guide with actors and transactions defined.
Deployment Guidance Contains technical specifications and guidance relevant to this Implementation Guide and supporting guidance for adaptation in local environments.

The specification herewith documented is a demo working specification, and may not be used for any implementation purposes.
